Look here.... From the NSA's website.

Definitely Aliens.

http://www.nsa.gov/public_info/_files/ufo/key_to_et_messages.pdf

Edited October 25, 2015 by musicpenguin
Fancy giving more information so we don't have to download a pdf file?

A quick google search gives you this:

On April 21, 2011 the National Security Agency posted documents from their Technical Journal which had some interesting articles about extraterrestrials. Some have assumed that these documents were pertaining to messages received from extraterrestrials, an easy mistake to make with article titles such as Ã¢â‚¬Å“Key to the Extraterrestrial Messages.Ã¢â‚¬Â These documents are actually related to exercises for practicing deciphering coded messages that extraterrestrials may send us in the future. However, there is still a story here, because these exercises were started by a prominent NSA cryptologist who believed more attention needed to be given to the investigation of UFOs and the possibility that we may be contacted soon.

The government probably won't tell us until the aliens decide to hurl a superdense asteroid at our planet...

I was talking to a fellow who used to work in the USAF. Apparently, what the government shows in public is usually less advanced than what they are testing and have in storage.

*aliens invade Earth*

*International Space Fleet blows up alien homeworld*

Aliens: WTF????

The stamp in the bottom left corner of the first page clearly says "Approved for Release by NSA on 10-21-2004, FOIA Case # 41472" October 2004, that's almost 9 years ago. A declassified document containing world shocking information won't stay hidden for 9 years. I doubt this document contains anything of that nature.
